plot_utils¶

utils.plot_utils.visualize_correlation_per_window(self, plt_oject, input_data_dictionary)¶
utils.plot_utils.visualize_pyplot(cbr_fox_instance, **kwargs)¶

Visualize the best cases' components using Matplotlib.

This method plots the components of the best cases, along with the forecasted window and prediction, to aid in visual analysis. Users can customize the appearance and behavior of the plots through Matplotlib configurations passed via kwargs.

Parameters:

  • cbr_fox_instance (cbr_fox) --

    An instance of the cbr_fox class, containing precomputed data for correlation and analysis. Required attributes include: - input_data_dictionary: A dictionary containing keys such as "forecasted_window", "prediction",

    "target_training_windows", and "window_len".

    • best_windows_index: A list of indices representing the best windows.

    • records_array: A structured array containing analysis results.

  • **kwargs (dict, optional) -- Additional parameters for customizing the plots: - forecast_label (str): Label for the forecasted window line. Default is "Forecasted Window". - prediction_label (str): Label for the prediction point. Default is "Prediction". - fmt (str): Format string for plotting the best windows. - plot_params (dict): Additional arguments for ax.plot when plotting best windows. - scatter_params (dict): Additional arguments for ax.scatter when plotting target points. - xlim (tuple): Limits for the x-axis. - ylim (tuple): Limits for the y-axis. - xtick_rotation (int): Rotation angle for x-axis ticks. Default is 0. - xtick_ha (str): Horizontal alignment for x-axis ticks. Default is 'right'. - title (str): Title for each plot. Default is "Plot {i + 1}". - xlabel (str): Label for the x-axis. Default is "Axis X". - ylabel (str): Label for the y-axis. Default is "Axis Y". - legend (bool): Whether to display the legend. Default is True.

Returns:

A list of tuples, where each tuple contains: - fig : matplotlib.figure.Figure

The figure object for the plot.

  • axmatplotlib.axes._axes.Axes

    The axes object for the plot.

Return type:

list of tuple

Notes

  • Ensure that the cbr_fox_instance contains all required attributes before calling this method.

  • This method depends on Matplotlib for visualization.
